Entity.description: Represents any individual or system that can initiate an action within the cloud environment.

User.description: A human or service account that can be authenticated and authorized to take actions on cloud resources.

Role.description: A set of permissions that define what actions are allowed and forbidden by an entity assuming the role.

Group.description: A collection of users under one set of permissions, simplifying the management of access controls.

Service.description: AWS services that perform actions on your behalf to accomplish specific tasks.

Resource.description: Any AWS resource that can be interacted with, such as instances, buckets, or databases.

Compute.description: Compute instances such as virtual machines or container services.

Storage.description: Storage resources, including object stores and block storage systems.

Database.description: Database instances, including relational and NoSQL databases.

KeyManagement.description: Services and entities related to the management of encryption keys.

Key.description: An encryption key used to secure data in AWS services.

KeyPolicy.description: Policies associated with encryption keys, defining who can access and manage the keys.
